subject: Personal Finance
title: How the Gold Standard Died
description: Learn How the Gold Standard Died in one minute.

hook.text: On August 15, 1971, Nixon went on TV and severed the dollar's link to gold forever.

buildup.text: After WWII, the dollar was pegged to gold at $35 per ounce under the Bretton Woods system.

discovery.text: France and others demanded gold for their dollars. The US was running out of reserves.

twist.text: Nixon called it temporary. Over 50 years later, we're still living in that 'temporary' system.

climax.text: Since 1971, money is backed only by government promise. Welcome to the era of fiat currency.

quiz.question: What happened on August 15, 1971?
options: Nixon ended the dollar's convertibility to gold
The first paper dollar was printed
